item.title: Abandoned moped, 26th November
item.description:
This moped has been in situ for some time - possible over 12 months. It is very dirty and does not appear to be maintained. There are no registration plates so we cannot trace the owner. We have asked residents to come forward if it is theres and have left notices on the bike, as you can see from the photo, but nobody has come forward. We therefore do not believe the owner is living at the flats. Please can the council look into this and remove it?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillreach, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Better solution needed for queens road litter, 26th November
item.description:
Every day there are takeaway boxes, bones, cans, bones, more bones dropped outside the takeaways on Queens Road. There needs to be a solution. A lot of it is from the school kids from St Thomas the Apostle. Please consider a letter to the headteacher to highlight the issue with their pupils and also letters to the takeaways asking them to take responsibility- they can ask customers to bring their rubbish back and not to litter. Or the takeaways need to take responsibility and clean up the street. It's an ongoing problem bringing vermin to the area and is unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151-155, Queen's Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road seems to be sinking at the end of the road, 26th November
item.description:
At the end of Pinewood Avenue, Hollies Ave end, the road has a big crack and due to the amount of traffic the road now seems to be sinking at that point. This has gradually been getting worse over the last few weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pinewood Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
